intro: Echium × scilloniense, commonly known as the hybrid blueweed, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. Echium × scilloniense is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
